title: Connectionism and the problem of systematicity: Why Smolensky's solution doesn't work

tldr.text: It is argued that weak compositional structure is irrelevant to the systematicity problem and of dubious internal coherence, and that strong compositional representations fail to explain systematicity because they fail to exhibit the sort of constituents that can provide domains for structure sensitive mental processes.
